item.title: The Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau extends a warm welcome to Muslim travelers
item.description: Source: Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau The Yokohama Convention & Visitors Bureau (YCVB) reports that its specialized Muslim Tourist Information microsite, part of the official Yokohama Visitors’ Guide website, is gaining traction with Muslims in Southeast Asia. Launched in December 2013, the Muslim Tourist Information website highlights tourist attractions, dining, halal shops, and mosques, all recommended by Yokohama’s Muslim residents. A survey of Southeast Asian Muslims revealed that over 90% found the information on restaurants, mosques, and recommended itineraries helpful.

item.title: Discover the enchantment of port cities at the Asian Civilisations Museum
item.description: Source: ACM website. A view of Singapore from Mount Wallich, painted in 1856 by Percy Carpenter, is one of the pieces displayed at the Port Cities: Multicultural Emporiums of Asia, 1500–1900 exhibition. Port cities are vibrant hubs where people from diverse backgrounds converge, bringing with them a rich tapestry of goods and ideas. The special exhibition Port Cities: Multicultural Emporiums of Asia, 1500–1900 at the Asian Civilisations Museum offers a glimpse into this fascinating world through various mediums including photographs, paintings, textiles, luxury items, and everyday objects.
